name: Death Dog
lore: A death dog is a two-headed hound whose dual heads share a single diseased mind. Death dogs roam in packs across desolate wastelands and deserts, dragging down prey with venomous bites. When a death dog's poison courses through a victim, it leaves the creature weak and debilitated, vulnerable to the pack's continued assault.

traits.name: Two Heads
traits.description: The dog has Advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and on saving throws against the Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Frightened, Stunned, and Unconscious conditions.

multiattack.description: The dog makes two Bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +4, reach 5 ft. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) Piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or have the Poisoned condition until the target finishes a Short or Long Rest. If the target already has the Poisoned condition from this attack, it instead takes 7 (2d6) Poison damage.

conditions.duration: until the target finishes a Short or Long Rest

onFailure.effects: If the target already has the Poisoned condition from this attack, it instead takes 7 (2d6) Poison damage.
